1: <sup>1</sup> Praise ye the LORD: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.
2: <sup>2</sup> The LORD doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
3: <sup>3</sup> He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.
4: <sup>4</sup> He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.
5: <sup>5</sup> Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.
6: <sup>6</sup> The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.
7: <sup>7</sup> Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:
8: <sup>8</sup> Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.
9: <sup>9</sup> He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.
10: <sup>10</sup> He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.
11: <sup>11</sup> The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.
12: <sup>12</sup> Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.
13: <sup>13</sup> For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.
14: <sup>14</sup> He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.
15: <sup>15</sup> He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.
16: <sup>16</sup> He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.
17: <sup>17</sup> He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?
18: <sup>18</sup> He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
19: <sup>19</sup> He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
20: <sup>20</sup> He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.
